title: Iceye launches radar satellite service to monitor the high seas
summary: The new service, called Ocean Vision, pairs SAR data with computer vision techniques

title: UK Government Pledges £10M in Funding to SaxaVord
summary: The UK government has pledged £10 million in funding to SaxaVord Spaceport in Scotland, which is expected to host a maiden orbital launch later...

title: Italy in Space: Setting New Records for Electric Propulsion in Routine Operations
summary: On December 1, 2023 at 6:19 PM (UTC), the first Italian all-electric satellite “MicroHETSat”, designed and built by SITAEL for the European Space Agency with Italian Space Agency (ASI) support, […]

title: SpaceX adds tests to next Starship flight
summary: SpaceX is planning a more ambitious set of in-flight tests of its Starship vehicle on its next launch to demonstrate capabilities needed for launching satellites and going to the moon.

title: New Glenn completes initial cryogenic testing at Launch Complex 36
summary: Blue Origin continues to take big steps forward with its New Glenn orbital rocket as hardware rolls out to the launch pad, cryogenic testing begins, and the BE-4 engine gains a new test stand. The company still aims to launch New Glenn at least once in 2024.
